title: shortDescription
content: CEUS utilizes microbubble contrast agents to enhance ultrasound imaging, providing improved visualization of vascular structures and blood flow.

title: Imaging Principle
content: CEUS utilizes microbubble contrast agents to enhance the backscatter of ultrasound waves, improving visualization of blood flow and vascular structures. Microbubbles resonate with ultrasound waves, creating strong acoustic signals that enhance contrast in real-time imaging.

title: Primary File Format(s)
content: DICOM (.dcm), AVI (.avi), MP4 (.mp4), JPEG (.jpg), PNG (.png), WAV (.wav), MOV (.MOV), RAW (.RAW), SR, TIFF (.TIFF), VIV (.viv), VOL (.vol)

title: Conversion Solutions + Reference
content: nii2dcm converts NIfTI files into DICOM format, using Python, Docker, SimpleITK, highdicom.
FSL utilities handle conversion and neuroimaging data processing.
Sante DICOM Editor for versatile multimedia conversion.
Python script using Pillow and pydicom to convert images.
Python script replacing pixel data in existing DICOM files.
SimpleITK to create synthetic DICOM series from arrays.
pixelmed toolkit for detailed TIFF-to-DICOM conversion.

title: Spatial Resolution
content: Typically 50–500 microns; Axial: ~100–300 microns; Lateral: ~200–500 microns

title: Equipment Used
content: High-frequency ultrasound transducers, Contrast-specific imaging modes (e.g., nonlinear imaging), Ultrasound contrast agents (microbubbles)

title: Typical Manufacturers
content: GE Healthcare, Philips Healthcare, Siemens Healthineers, Canon Medical Systems

title: Primary Uses
content: Liver lesion characterization (HCC, metastases, hemangiomas), Kidney and prostate imaging, Cardiovascular imaging (e.g., myocardial perfusion)

title: Specialized Uses
content: Assessing tumor vascularity and treatment response, Imaging inflammatory bowel diseases, Contrast-enhanced endoscopic ultrasound (CE-EUS)

title: Safety Concerns
content: Rare allergic reactions to microbubble contrast agents, Potential cavitation effects (at very high ultrasound intensities)

title: Common Preprocessing Steps
content: Noise filtering, Motion correction, Contrast-agent tracking, Intensity normalization

title: Compression Methods (if any)
content: DICOM JPEG 2000 for video storage, Proprietary ultrasound system compression

title: Technical Challenges
content: Limited penetration depth (high-frequency ultrasound attenuates quickly), Operator dependency (user skill affects image quality), Microbubble lifespan (contrast agent dissipates quickly)

title: Clinical Limitations
content: Limited reimbursement (varies by country), Contrast agent availability (not approved in all regions), Lower sensitivity in obese patients

title: confirmed_by
content: Not confirmed, need to be rechecked
